alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 1:37PM MST until January 04 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with localized amounts up to 6 inches. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Fredonia, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, Kachina Village, Munds Park, North Rim, Sedona, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Snow forecast from 5 PM Today to 8 AM Thursday: Doney Park 1 to 2 inches Flagstaff 2 to 4 inches Fredonia 0 to 1 inches Grand Canyon 2 to 4 inches Jacob Lake 4 to 6 inches Kachina Village 3 to 5 inches Munds Park 4 to 6 inches North Rim 4 to 8 inches Sedona 0 to 1 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Williams 3 to 5 inches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
